content.rendered:
Pupils attend the school from across Birmingham and some other neighbouring local authorities.

All of the children who attend Lea Hall Academy have a Statement of Special Educational Need or an Education and Health Care Plan. Our school educates boys who have Social, Emotional and Mental Health (SEMH) needs.

In our endeavour to meet their wide ranging educational and social needs, we provide an appropriate curriculum, which encompasses and extends the National Curriculum. Our whole school curriculum model provides a natural progression towards full participation within the National Curriculum framework, with programmes designed for and implemented at an appropriate level.

excerpt.rendered: Lea Hall Academy is a Primary and Key Stage 3 boys Special School situated in the eastern area of Birmingham.
